name: Home Purification & Nowruz Preparation
description: A 40-day guide for 'Khoune-Tekani' (Spring Cleaning) and setting up the 'Haft-Sin' table, focusing on ancient Persian traditions and national rites.

days.title: Beginning the Purification from Closets
days.description: Start your spring cleaning by letting go of one small closet or drawer. Discard unused tools to make space for the Fravahars (ancestral spirits) to soar through your home. Learn more: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fravashi

days.title: Donating Surplus Belongings
days.description: Separate things you no longer need. Giving these items to others gladdens the heart and spreads goodness throughout the world.

days.title: Polishing Mirrors and Frames
days.description: Clean your mirrors and family portraits. The mirror is a symbol of light and truthfulness and must shine brightly for the New Year.

days.title: Organizing Seasonings
days.description: Discard old spices and wipe down the shelves. The fresh scent of herbs should never be mixed with the smell of staleness.

days.title: Washing Light Curtains
days.description: Wash sheer curtains and hang them while damp so the scent of cleanliness and novelty fills the room.

days.title: Cleaning the Lamps
days.description: Clean every glass and crystal of your lamps one by one. The house must be full of 'Forough' (radiance) during the festival nights.

days.title: Tending to the Plants
days.description: Nourish the soil in your pots and remove dry leaves. Plants also move toward spring alongside us.

days.title: Dusting the Library, Shahnameh, and Hafez
days.description: Dust your books and pick a place for the Shahnameh (The Book of Kings) and the Divan of Hafez on the Nowruz table. As the great Ferdowsi says: 'They scattered jewels on Jamshid... and called that day the New Day (Nowruz).' https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shahnameh

days.title: Cleaning Living Room Windows
days.description: Clean the glass so the 'Sheed' (radiant light) of the spring sun shines perfectly into the house. A clean window opens the heart.

days.title: Essential Fridge Cleaning
days.description: Take out all fridge shelves and wash them. Remove old food to make room for fresh holiday feasts.

days.title: Storing Winter Clothing
days.description: Gather warm, woolly garments and put them in storage. It is time for the closets to be released from the weight of winter.

days.title: Organizing Spring Attire
days.description: Bring out light and bright-colored clothes. Joyful colors transform the human soul for the New Year.

days.title: Cleaning the Hearth (The Stove)
days.description: Polish the stove until it looks brand new. This is the heart of the kitchen and must be ready to cook the festival meals.

days.title: Washing Cushion Covers and Runners
days.description: Wash small cushions and tablecloths. These small changes completely refresh the face of the home.

days.title: Organizing the Threshold
days.description: Clear the shoe rack and wipe the entrance door. The first place a guest sees should be adorned and welcoming.

days.title: Dusting Under Beds and Sofas
days.description: Vacuum the places that were hard to reach during the year. No dust should remain in the hidden corners of the house.

days.title: Cleaning Walls and Light Switches
days.description: Wipe stains off the walls and attend to the light switches. When small details are clean, the whole house suddenly shines.

days.title: Maintaining Kitchen Appliances
days.description: Thoroughly descale and clean the microwave, tea maker, and other appliances. Kitchen devices must be ready for the busy holiday days.

days.title: Soaking Seeds for Sabzeh
days.description: If you want wheat sprouts (Sabzeh), start today. Watching seeds turn green gives a sense of life. https://youtu.be/mfWr2yTw4pM?si=_4ozN5gX3Og4MqV5

days.title: Washing Hosting Dishware
days.description: Wash and dry the beautiful guest sets that were in the cabinets to prepare for hosting loved ones.

days.title: Tending to Shoes and Bags
days.description: Wipe down shoes, polish if needed, and organize bags. From head to toe, we must be adorned for the New Year.

days.title: Cleaning the Bathroom and Toilet
days.description: Give the bathroom and toilet a thorough cleaning. Make everything sparkle and replace with fresh, fragrant towels.

days.title: Preparing Senjed and Sumac
days.description: Clean and set aside the dried oleaster (Senjed) and sumac. Each is a beautiful symbol of our 'Haft-Sin' table.

days.title: Buying Candles and Tulips for the Table
days.description: To illuminate the table, procure beautiful candles or colorful tulips. Light is a symbol of victory over darkness.

days.title: Final Floor Cleansing
days.description: Clean the floors with a fragrant wash. The aroma of cleanliness should fill the entire space.

days.title: Organizing Photo Albums
days.description: Take a look at old photos and reminisce about happy memories. Nowruz is a time to connect with our roots.

days.title: Preparing Garlic and Vinegar
days.description: Get the garlic and vinegar ready. Garlic symbolizes guarding the body, and vinegar represents patience and endurance.

days.title: Buying Fresh Red Apples
days.description: Select ripe, red apples. The apple is a symbol of beauty, health, and prosperity.

days.title: Planning the Festival of Red Fire
days.description: Seven days until 'Chaharshanbe Suri'! If you want to host a gathering, coordinate with relatives and friends starting today. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chaharshanbe_Suri

days.title: Samanu Making (Step 1: Soaking Wheat)
days.description: Clean the high-quality wheat and let it soak to sprout. This is the beginning of creating one of the most powerful 'Sins' (elements) of the table. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samanu, check this video on how to make it: https://youtu.be/_DnyRStVb7Q?si=Nd9qtmCDkTCMxhVq

days.title: Tending to Wheat Sprouts
days.description: Check the Samanu wheat regularly. Don't let them dry out; they are preparing the juice of life for the Samanu.

days.title: Tending to Samanu Sprouts
days.description: Check the wheat sprouts regularly and water them. The growth of these sprouts heralds the arrival of spring.

days.title: Polishing the Mirror and Haft-Sin Glass
days.description: Shine the mirror and prepare the beautiful glasses for the layout so they glow on the Nowruz table.

days.title: Samanu Making (Step 2: Cooking)
days.description: Now that the sprouts have turned silver, extract their juice and cook it with flour until your Samanu (wheat germ pudding) is ready. checkout again this video if needed: https://youtu.be/_DnyRStVb7Q?si=Nd9qtmCDkTCMxhVq

days.title: Preparation for the Night of Fire
days.description: Tomorrow is Chaharshanbe Suri! Prepare the nuts and snacks for a night full of passion and energy.

days.title: Festival of Red Fire (Chaharshanbe Suri)
days.description: Tonight is for jumping over the fire. Give your yellowness (sickness) to the fire and take back its redness (vitality/health).

days.title: Preparing for Sabzi-Polo with Fish
days.description: For the New Year's Eve dinner of Sabzi-Polo (herb rice) with fish, wash the fresh herbs and prepare the fish. link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sabzi_polo

days.title: Arranging Sweets and Nuts
days.description: Arrange delicious Persian treats and 'Ajil' (nuts) in special dishes. The house now smells of spring.

days.title: Cooking Sabzi-Polo with Fish
days.description: Complete the last meal of the year with Sabzi-Polo (herb rice) and fish. The scent of fresh herbs and garlic will fill the home. https://youtu.be/ERKLw_B8Weo?si=1JXSuZIzFroSSPCA

days.title: Nowruz and the Turning of the Year
days.description: Burn wild rue (Espand) and frankincense, wear new clothes, and sit by the Haft-Sin table. The 7 'S' symbols are: 1. Sabzeh (Rebirth) 2. Samanu (Power/Strength) 3. Senjed (Love/Wisdom) 4. Seer (Health/Medicine) 5. Seeb (Beauty) 6. Somaq (Sunrise/Patience) 7. Serkeh (Immortal Patience). Nowruz Pirooz! https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haft-sin
